meta.title: The Big Red Machine & Ohio Sports

questions.text: Which Cincinnati Reds manager was known as 'Captain Hook' for changing pitchers?
questions.explanation: Sparky Anderson managed the Big Red Machine to World Series titles in 1975 and 1976.

questions.text: Who was the 'Hit King' of the Cincinnati Reds?
questions.explanation: Pete Rose is the all-time MLB leader in hits (4,256).

questions.text: Which Ohio State football coach famously punched a Clemson player in 1978?
questions.explanation: The legendary Woody Hayes was fired after punching Charlie Bauman in the 1978 Gator Bowl.

questions.text: The 'Miracle of Richfield' refers to which team's 1975-76 season?
questions.explanation: The Cavs, led by Bill Fitch, had an unforgettable season at the Richfield Coliseum.

questions.text: Who is the only player to win the Heisman Trophy twice?
questions.explanation: Archie Griffin of Ohio State won the Heisman in 1974 and 1975.

questions.text: Which Cleveland Browns running back is considered one of the greatest of all time?
questions.explanation: Jim Brown played for the Browns from 1957-1965 and led the league in rushing 8 times.

questions.text: Which catcher was the heart of the Big Red Machine?
questions.explanation: Johnny Bench is widely regarded as the greatest catcher in baseball history.

questions.text: Before 2022, the Cleveland Guardians were known as the:
questions.explanation: The team was named the Cleveland Indians from 1915 to 2021.

questions.text: Which Cincinnati Bengals quarterback led the team to Super Bowl XVI?
questions.explanation: Ken Anderson was the league MVP in 1981 and led the Bengals to their first Super Bowl.

questions.text: What is the nickname of Ohio State University's stadium?
questions.explanation: Ohio Stadium is affectionately known as 'The Horseshoe' or 'The Shoe' due to its shape.

questions.text: Who founded the Cleveland Browns and the Cincinnati Bengals?
questions.explanation: Paul Brown was a coaching innovator who founded both Ohio NFL franchises.

questions.text: Which 'Big Red Machine' player was known as 'Little Joe'?
questions.explanation: Hall of Fame second baseman Joe Morgan was the engine of the team.

questions.text: The 'Kardiac Kids' were the 1980 version of which team?
questions.explanation: The 1980 Browns were famous for their heart-stopping, last-minute victories.

questions.text: LeBron James was drafted by the Cavaliers in which year?
questions.explanation: The 'Kid from Akron' was the #1 overall pick in the 2003 NBA Draft.

questions.text: Which golf legend is from Columbus, Ohio, and nicknamed 'The Golden Bear'?
questions.explanation: Jack Nicklaus, with 18 major championships, hails from Upper Arlington, Ohio.
